N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 621.4 - Requirements for a State aid grant

State Regulations
(a) A
local government (see glossary, section
621.17
of this Part) or a
voluntary agency (see glossary) may apply for a State aid grant for the capital
costs of construction. (b) A
completed application must be submitted to the commissioner (see glossary, section
621.17
) in the format and on the
forms prescribed by the commissioner. The application must include a statement
to the effect that, if the applicant is a voluntary agency, the applicant and
OPWDD intend that the State aid grant must be repaid when and if the applicant
receives an FDC mortgage loan pursuant to this Part; provided that such
repayment shall be intended only for that portion of the State aid grant
represented by underlying costs for which the FDC mortgage loan is
made. (c) Companies and sponsors or
proposed incorporators of such companies, may apply for State aid, an HFA
mortgage loan, or for both. (d) A
certification of need application pursuant to the commissioner's regulations
must be completed and approved prior to the payment of State aid grant
funds. (e) The applicant must
provide copies of existing contracts, if any, relating to the acquisition, construction and operation of the proposed facility. (f) All applicants receiving State aid are
required to establish and maintain accounting and fiscal records in a manner
approved by the commissioner to reflect the receipt and expenditure of funds
allotted and paid for capital costs. Similar suitable accounts shall be
maintained to show receipt and disbursement of Federal, local or other funds
used for matching purposes. (g) The
applicant for a State aid grant must have or will have, prior to receiving

State aid funds, a fee simple or such other estate or interest in the site
including necessary easements and rights-of-way, sufficient to assure for a
period not less than 50 years undisturbed use and possession for the purpose of
the facility. At the commissioner's discretion, a limited amount of grant funds
may be provided to the applicant prior to the applicant taking fee simple to
the site, provided that such funds are placed in escrow and are used solely for
the purpose of acquiring title to the site. (h) The nature and extent of the applicant's
present or anticipated property rights in the proposed site must be established
by a survey of the site, the surveyor's metes and bounds property description
and an acceptable policy of title insurance. (i) The commissioner shall have access to the
books, records and physical site of any facility receiving a State aid
grant. Notes
